required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Daily Wear Comparison of Enhanced and Non-Enhanced Silicone Hydrogel Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Daily Wear Comparison of Enhanced and Non-Enhanced Silicone Hydrogel Lenses

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare an experimental contact lens with a currently marketed contact lens.

primary_outcome.description: Overall vision was interpreted by the subject and recorded on a questionnaire as a single, retrospective evaluation of 1-week wear time. Overall vision was evaluated by eye and rated on a 10-point scale, with 1 being poor and 10 being excellent.

arm_group.description: Lotrafilcon A experimental contact lens randomly assigned to one eye
Lotrafilcon A commercial contact lens randomly assigned to one eye

intervention.description: Experimental spherical, silicone hydrogel soft contact lens
Commercially marketed spherical, silicone hydrogel soft contact lens

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Able to wear contact lenses for a minimum of 5 days a week, at least 8 hours a day
- On exam have ocular findings that are considered normal and would not prevent the safe wear of contact lenses
- Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply
Exclusion Criteria:
- Requires concurrent ocular medication
- Eye injury or surgery within twelve weeks immediately prior to enrollment
- Evidence of systemic or ocular abnormality, infection, or disease likely to affect successful wear of contact lenses or use of their accessory solutions
- Any active corneal infection
- Any use of medications for which contact lens wear would be contraindicated
- History of corneal refractive surgery
- Wears toric contact lenses
- Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: One participant was enrolled but not dispensed due to failing inclusion criteria. This participant is included in the Actual Enrollment calculation, but not Participant Flow or Baseline Characteristics calculations.

group.title: Experimental Contact Lens / Commercial Contact Lens
group.description: Lotrafilcon A experimental contact lens randomly assigned to one eye, with Lotrafilcon A commercial contact lens assigned to the fellow eye for contralateral wear.

group.title: Experimental Contact Lens / Commercial Contact Lens
group.description: Lotrafilcon A experimental contact lens randomly assigned to one eye, with Lotrafilcon A commercial contact lens assigned to the fellow eye for contralateral wear.

outcome.title: Overall Vision
outcome.description: Overall vision was interpreted by the subject and recorded on a questionnaire as a single, retrospective evaluation of 1-week wear time. Overall vision was evaluated by eye and rated on a 10-point scale, with 1 being poor and 10 being excellent.
outcome.population: Per Protocol. Two participants were excluded from analysis due to major protocol deviations as determined by masked review. One participant was not analyzed due to discontinuation.

group.title: Lotrafilcon A Commercial Contact Lens
group.description: Commercial spherical silicone hydrogel contact lens worn for one week on the same basis as habitual lenses -- ie., either on a daily wear or extended wear modality.

group.title: Lotrafilcon A Experimental Contact Lens
group.description: Experimental spherical silicone hydrogel contact lens worn for one week on the same basis as habitual lenses -- ie., either on a daily wear or extended wear modality.

measure.title: Overall Vision
measure.description: Overall vision was interpreted by the subject and recorded on a questionnaire as a single, retrospective evaluation of 1-week wear time. Overall vision was evaluated by eye and rated on a 10-point scale, with 1 being poor and 10 being excellent.
measure.population: Per Protocol. Two participants were excluded from analysis due to major protocol deviations as determined by masked review. One participant was not analyzed due to discontinuation.

group.title: Lotrafilcon A Commercial Contact Lens
group.description: Commercial spherical silicone hydrogel contact lens

group.title: Lotrafilcon A Experimental Contact Lens
group.description: Experimental spherical silicone hydrogel contact lens

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: For a period of 10 years, the clinical investigator must hold all trial-related information and documents confidential and must agree to obtain sponsor's written consent before discussing, presenting, publicizing, or otherwise disclosing any pre-clinical and/or clinical data or impressions from this trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Priya Janakiraman, OD, FAAO / Head, Global Clinical Affairs
